website_summaries.verdict: A very quiet option. The incline angles are not as steep as others we considered, so elderly or physically challenged users should be able to use it easily.
pros: Belt surface is textured for additional stability
cons: Belt can be difficult to adjust
Belt speed is variable, not a smooth tempo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Treadmill for Office
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my office so I could get some activity in during the day. It works great. Fair warning, if you have never used a manual treadmill before you may want to try out walking on an incline first. This is NO joke. Not only are you on a slight incline but it's obviously a little hard to walk on than an automatic one. It is a great workout though, I would recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Christy S

customer_reviews.title: Nice & easy; works well
customer_reviews.text: It's not as smooth or consistent as an electric, because it isn't an electric. For what it is, it's great. It arrived within a week of ordering, was easy to set up, and works fine. You do need to get a feel for it at first, but that only took like 10 seconds. Anyone still experiencing "stopping" just needs to adjust the belt and add lubricant. A small bottle should really be included, but that was cheap and arrived just a day later, so again no complaints. I did not find it overly fast at any point, and running, walking, or slowly strolling are all possible.
customer_reviews.author: J Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: magnet for sensor on wrong side.  Still waiting for Stamina to get back to me on a fix.
customer_reviews.text: The base comes as a pre-assembled unit so I first thought my issue was faulty wiring. after inspecting further I found they installed the magnet on the wheel opposite the sensor. I have reached out to the company about this and replied to the email they sent asking for specs, serial no., etc and have not heard back from them. that aside the treadmill works as expected. I'm waiting for a response before I get to the deadline for returning this as if it was a unit without the sensor it should be cheaper. the fix is easy, just send me another magnet and I'll glue it on.
customer_reviews.author: M C

customer_reviews.title: Herky-Jerky and not a smooth walk at all.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together, but this treadmill is not useable. The motion is herky-jerky and it is not a smooth walk. I sprayed the silicon and there still was no improvement. I bought this particular one because of the incline and reviews. I'm happy it worked out well for others, but it is not usable for me.
customer_reviews.author: Ceectee

customer_reviews.title: How do I contact this company?
customer_reviews.text: Wire was cut so the timer doesn't work. I can't figure out how to contact the company for a fix. Maybe they read reviews?
customer_reviews.author: Alaska

customer_reviews.title: Good thing Amazon Prime has free return shipping
customer_reviews.text: Unstable and doesn't glide smoothly, even after carefully adjusting and lubricating the belt. Purchased for someone recovering from surgery and they were unable to safely use it. Good thing Amazon Prime has free return shipping!!! I'm an engineer, and they need to add a cross-brace to prevent wobbling - this would only add a few $ to the cost, so I'm not sure why they left that out. Nothing can be done cheaply to make the belt glide more smoothly. Keep it lubed with silicone spray (sold separately), and know that it takes some effort with each step to get it moving, and that it offers no resistance to keep you from going off the back.
customer_reviews.author: Keith D.

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, but not what was expected. It feels like it is either completely stopped or I’ll fly off at any moment if I don’t hold on the the rail. It’s more a workout for my arms than anything. Would not advise to buy this product, waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I find it a little difficult to walk on. ...
customer_reviews.text: I find it a little difficult to walk on. The belt, no matter how I adjust it, seems to slip periodically. I use it but I have to be very careful so I don't fall. It is also a lot noisier than I thought it would be. The whole reason I purchased a manual treadmill is so that it would be quiet; the walking surface makes a lot of noise as moves.
customer_reviews.author: Doc Kerby

customer_reviews.title: rotating tarp doesn’t stay in the middle, it creates noise
customer_reviews.text: Affordable, easy to assemble and perfect for tiny NYC apartments. It would’ve been perfect if only the rotating tarp stays in the middle. It keeps sliding slowly to one side and it creates noise ones it hits to the sides. I had to stop and move it manually to the middle every time. Eventually I had to return it after I hurt my finger from keeping the tarp in the middle. I hope they can fix the glitch because other than that it’s a good product. I’ll buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Yvette

customer_reviews.title: That it work very well, watch the videos in youtube.
customer_reviews.text: I love it! it's not bulky and I can folded it and put it in my closet. I didn't like the fact that i couldn't walk or run with my arms free but by holding on while I walk or jog I am developing strong arms. At the beginning it was a little difficult but I became accustomed fast and I get a very good work out. I truly feel that I get a totally different and better work out than from the electrical that I also use at the gym.
customer_reviews.author: Awilda

customer_reviews.title: Perfect  for me
customer_reviews.text: I was really impressed woth the tread when this arrived. Assembly took 15 minutes and it worked incredibly smoothly as soon as i stepped on it. I could walk and run on it and it is quiet and provides you with a good start to working out. Its simple, does the job and I think its perfect for a workout before and after work. Ill use it every day. For the price, it completely worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Thompson

customer_reviews.title: small mod makes much easier to use
customer_reviews.text: for the price this is pretty decent. Its can be a little jerky stopping and starting due to friction since it doesnt have a motor This leaves you to have to hang on kinda tight, also, I am 6ft 2 and the hand grips are pretty low. I tied a rope around the hand grips so I can clip and unclip it. Using this as a belt behind my waist really takes the pressure off my hands and makes it much smoother to use.
customer_reviews.author: JohnnyCache

customer_reviews.title: Used product
customer_reviews.text: First off, the product was used, please see attached. Also, the belt kept sliding from side to side. The incline was too steep for me. What a shame I was lured in by the price. Save your self the time and money and just get a motorized treadmill.
customer_reviews.author: Morena

customer_reviews.title: Walking only, not even safe for that. 190lbs still too heavy for even walking use.
customer_reviews.text: Not safe, what a pain this thing was. Belt constantly moving to the side. KEEP IN MIND this cannot be used for running, I don't know that I really see it on their product description but you WILL get hurt if you run on this. I weigh around 190 and the belt requires me to really push on the handlebars to get it moving. We returned this product, you get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan'n'Kerstin Cornell

customer_reviews.title: Hard to say anything good about this product
customer_reviews.text: Hard to say anything good about this product. Every time I try to use it the belt moves from side to side and I have to stop my workout every 30 seconds to loosen the bolt in order to move the belt back, and then tighten them again in order to get back to my workout. What a waste of time. I've searched everywhere for how to keep the belt in one place and nothing works. Now it's too late to return it, I'm stuck with this machine that doesn't work. Very frustrating. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Laker

customer_reviews.title: Never buy this
customer_reviews.text: The tredmill design and looks are fantastic but does not function good at all i rate it 1/10 as a bodybuilder because the rotating weights on left and right are not enough for momentum so that it does not give the walking comfort. very unprofessional walking feel feels like walking on a loose tyre which doesn't have control to front and back . I do not recommend this tredmill if you buy this, this will just sit there for a long time!
customer_reviews.author: gokul

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: No matter what I do the belt stops when you are walking on it. I have lubricated it. I can't return it because too much time has passed so I basically have a piece of junk
customer_reviews.author: Angela A Miller

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my little space
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my little space. Easy to fold up and roll to a corner. At the 10 in incline the treadmill rolls easier, the 8 in incline is a little harder. I use the 8 in incline. Its like walking up stairs. Its very smooth, the only noise you hear is your feet walking on it. If you dont have a lot of room, this is the perfect treadmill for smaller spaces.
customer_reviews.author: J. S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Inexpensive Treadmill
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a small treadmill for my bedroom that would not cost a fortune and this one is great. I was unsure of it being a manual treadmill but I got used to it after a few time. The manual treadmill makes you work harder to keep a fast pace, which gives you a good workout. Also, you need to use the handles when running fast. Over all i like it and it and I use it every night! I would recommend for a small room.
customer_reviews.author: lauren

customer_reviews.title: This is great, no power required and easy to move around
customer_reviews.text: This is great, no power required and easy to move around. Girls get one of these and watch TV you will be back in that size 4 before you know it.
customer_reviews.author: Sares Kay

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good manual treadmill for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good manual treadmill for the price. It squeaks a lot when in use and the included LCD tracker isin't very useful. But overall its given me good use. Setup was very easy and it does not take up much space.
customer_reviews.author: Rohbert

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price, bad for tall people.
customer_reviews.text: It was easier to assemble than ikea furniture. Great deal for the price, and it’s compact so it fits in a corner nicely. I’m 5’8”, didn’t have a problem with it. Husband is 6 feet tall and the handlebar is too low. You really have to hang onto the handles since it will stop on a dime, and if you’re not hanging on, you will lose your balance. We modified it with bicycle handlebar extensions for him and its fine now.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Great treadmill for the price
customer_reviews.text: I got this tread mill and have been using it for a couple of weeks now. I am disabled and am due to have my hip replaced in October '15. I'm using it to strengthen up my legs so recovery go smoother. Once you get the hang of it it is very smooth and easy to use. I also got the silicone spray for it to help with the smoothness. I would recommend it to anyone on a limited budget and wants a treadmill hat you can fold up and put away when done.
customer_reviews.author: ShirleyB

customer_reviews.title: it is here already
customer_reviews.text: so far I love it, said come 8-11, it is here today, put together, all by myself an 83 year old woman, now too tired to try it, I did but little fast now, will get used to it fast, I need the walk exercise, any way, came in perfect condition and not as hard to put together as I thought when saw it, delivery guy was wonderful,
customer_reviews.author: Beverly Davies

customer_reviews.title: I hold onto the rails when I'm on it--but once you get the hang of it the workout is pretty good. As an added bonus
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this treadmill after doing research online. I wanted something that would let me burn calories while I watch TV. This machine has exceeded my expectations. Assembly was easy--there are only six bolts! It takes a little time to get used to walking or running on it--and, yes, I hold onto the rails when I'm on it--but once you get the hang of it the workout is pretty good. As an added bonus, it takes just seconds to fold it up and put it away. Bottom line, for the money, it's a great way to get off the couch and exercise.
customer_reviews.author: P. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Great item for the price
customer_reviews.text: Can't expect much more than this for the price. It works. Everything people say is true - can't run on it, need to hold bars. I can walk without holding the bars, but need to pay close attention. Definitely get a lube kit and use right away. The display is small, need to bend down to make out the display. It is easy to fold up and drive out of the way. I can certainly recommend it for a not too tall or heavy person who just wants to walk.
customer_reviews.author: SB in VA

customer_reviews.title: Maybe just for light weights
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps I was too heavy for this treadmill (250 lb). But it did not work for me at all. If you're 150 lb it might work OK but you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: mtnbilly

customer_reviews.title: High hopes were short lived...
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this machine. Light, portable, minimal assembly and decent build quality. The joy was short lived. The band is not well lubricated and is difficult to get going. No matter how many times I adjusted or added some lubrication, the band would not move easily. Returned after less than a week. Spend the extra money and get a low watt electric treadmill. You’ll be happier.
customer_reviews.author: AvgReviewer

customer_reviews.title: I really like it. My only issue is that I wish ...
customer_reviews.text: I use it all the time. I really like it. My only issue is that I wish I can put the legs down and not have it facing up. Make sure to get oil lub for this because it does not come with lub.
customer_reviews.author: Yusuf Diallo

customer_reviews.title: I like it, after a couple years of use though ...
customer_reviews.text: I like it, after a couple years of use though it has gotten difficult to move the track. I've attempted to add lubrication to the track and wheels to little success. I just consider the extra resistance to be strength training + cardio. But, it has survived for over 2 years of use and 3 moves. I'd say that warrants at least 4 stars for automatically adjusting to my fitness level (even if not intended by design).
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: I felt like I made a very careful decision after reading the ...
customer_reviews.text: I felt like I made a very careful decision after reading the reviews and product specifications on several different treadmills. The belt was very problematic and jerky. It would go a few seconds then jerk to a stop. I even got silicone spray as directed by troubleshooting and it didn't help much.
customer_reviews.author: V. J.

customer_reviews.title: Decent.
customer_reviews.text: Decent in a pinch, a little bit cheap and flimsy. Harder than an electric treadmill so that's good.
customer_reviews.author: Ben C

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Easy setup & it's worked perfectly so far. I'm 5'5, 175 lbs, and it's great for walking, jogging & running if you're brave. Plus, it's a surprisingly robust workout - controlling your balance & speed takes a lot of fine-tuned muscle movement that running on a powered treadmill doesn't. One tip: I'd recommend buying some treadmill lubricant & laying down a layer before the first use. I did, and it's been running great for about a year.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: same issue as everyone else. not a smooth walk ...
customer_reviews.text: same issue as everyone else. not a smooth walk at all. belt keeps shifting. Raising the end a bit (about 5" off the ground) helps to keep you from unwillingly having to enter a full-blown sprint, and I'm going to try to use multiple zip-ties around both cylinders on either side of the belt to keep it in place.
customer_reviews.author: BookCrateDotOrg

customer_reviews.title: Safety Concern
customer_reviews.text: I was super excited to use this treadmill. The reviews were right though, you need to be careful while on it since there is no E-Stop. I had to return it since it was somewhat wobbly if you weren't directly in the middle of the belt, and it also felt unstable if you didn't hold the hand railing. And no, I'm not elderly I'm a woman in my 20's. It didn't satisfy my needs for a treadmill, but maybe it will satisfy yours.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Good for the fit and young but not for those with pain
customer_reviews.text: This might be good for the young and healthy or those who are already fit. But I have an issue with chronic pain in my low back and right leg and had trouble with the non electric motor and incline- I was hurting after use and had to return it. I know have a golds gym electric treadmill with electric incline 0-10. I can only go to a 2 incline max. It was cheap and good deal at Walmart.
customer_reviews.author: Amber S.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Price
customer_reviews.text: Cheap price. Compact. Quiet. Does need under the belt to be greased with, I suggest, white lithium. Was super easy to put together, I did it while 8 months pregnant. The only thing you need to know is it's people powered. This isn't an electric, do the moving for you machine. The tread moves by you walking on it. Which is perfect for our apartment, since people live beneath us, it's nice and quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Natasha Lea

customer_reviews.title: Not the best
customer_reviews.text: The belt was very difficult to keep in line and it was not a smooth walk at all. Had to return it it was not a helpful part of my workout. It was also pretty flimsy not a good stable solid unit.
customer_reviews.author: VICTORIA

customer_reviews.title: Not disappointed at all
customer_reviews.text: For the money , this does everything it says it is going to do. I was not disappointed in one thing in this product. I purchased it when I could not get out of bed even for five minutes a day. This was a challenge. I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: HOMESTEAD

customer_reviews.title: steep
customer_reviews.text: heck of a workout. the angle is pretty extreme. i put a block of wood under the back to level a bit making it somewhat easier. very easy to fold up and move to store.
customer_reviews.author: e q

customer_reviews.title: Great concept but poorly executed
customer_reviews.text: Spent more time adjusting the belt centering than walking on it. Was not worth the buy. Great concept but poorly executed.
customer_reviews.author: BerZerKerX

customer_reviews.title: This little machine will have you crying "uncle" pretty quickly; don't let the size deceive you
customer_reviews.text: This little machine will have you crying "uncle" pretty quickly; don't let the size deceive you. I took the legs off, and this gives it even more of an incline. When I first saw it, I thought it would be a cake-walk, but it definitely causes you to work up a sweat because it's like walking up a hill. I like it and am glad I purchased it. It really revs up the heart-rate because it's all leg power.
customer_reviews.author: Seasoned Midget

customer_reviews.title: Not worth even a penny
customer_reviews.text: The worse purchase I have ever made. Don’t be chip like me and invest into a better product. It’s doesnt work and makes your completely miserable
customer_reviews.author: Yana

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use treadmill
customer_reviews.text: This is an easy to use product which is on an incline, helping to make you work harder, it stores away easily by just folding it.
customer_reviews.author: linda Rocka

customer_reviews.title: dont buy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for an Xmas gift for daughter. The treadmill works but the mat goes sideways during operation. Unfortunately she didn't put it together until the end of January Now Amazon advises it cannot be returned
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Steep, uncomfortable, and short
customer_reviews.text: The incline was too steep, making it uncomfortable to use, and you have to hold the handles to make it work. This was a problem for my height (5'10"), and I had to hunch down, so it was nearly impossible to use. My wife (5'2") was able to use it, but the conveyor belt is not very smooth, and made it less of an exercise and more of a tedious activity.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Smith

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good!
customer_reviews.text: This equipment is not bad. At first, the belt takes a little getting used to, but after a few miles it gets a lot smoother. Easy to put together.
customer_reviews.author: PABLO J RODRIGUEZ

customer_reviews.title: Don't like this. I have had motorized tread mill before ...
customer_reviews.text: Don't like this. I have had motorized tread mill before so that could be why. You can only go at one pace to keep thing moving. It is jerky. Incline is a bit high. I put books under back portion to cut incline. That is better, but once you get going, you can' t change it up. I bought treadmill lube, helps with Jerky belt, but still not great. I just really don't like it. So it does not get used. For me waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: BA

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great small treadmill for walking only. Well made and worth the money

customer_reviews.title: Good for walking
customer_reviews.text: Simple manual tread mill. It takes a little more effort to walk on the tread mill than walking around. It's on an incline and you need to move the belt. Also it didn't seem too feasible to walk on it without holding onto the bars for leverage. I wasn't able to run on it.
customer_reviews.author: JimmyT

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy! Not worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Very hard to use and not very sturdy. A waste of my money! It’s sitting in the garage. Guess it will eventually go to the dump.
customer_reviews.author: Joan E.

customer_reviews.title: Rubber tread slid off track after 2 minutes, impossible to get back on.
customer_reviews.text: After assembling this, I tried to align the tracking of the tread. I guess I went too far to the right on on adjustment, and the tread is now shoved against the side. I haven't spent too much time trying to fix this, but a good 30 minutes screwing with it, should yield some results. I didn't get anywhere. Save your dough, and buy an expensive ass electric one. I will.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for...
customer_reviews.text: The reviews are pretty accurate. Plus: Easy to put together, doesn't take up a lot of space, and gives a fairly decent workout. Downsides: Wonky/jerky pace, no choice but to use the handles unless you want to slide on your butt, definitely better suited for a shorter person (I'm 5foot and it's perfect- I feel for the taller ones), the "2" inclines hardly differ, and I wouldn't dream of running on this thing. The only reason I give this 3 stars and not two is because I'm going to give it some time and see how I feel about it after a week or two of use. I'm not impressed by any means thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Wimpster

customer_reviews.title: Terrible terrible NOT worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Terrible terrible NOT worth the money. Belt slips and drags. Bought this because of heart condition and need to walk indoors. The belt is jerky and hard to walk on. Very much regret buying this. Need to return It.
customer_reviews.author: carol wright

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased! And great price!
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I have been looking for. Doesn't take up a lot of space, it was easy to assemble, and the price was great too. It's a good, comfortable workout -- enough to get your heart rate up and I do break a bit of a sweat -- which is a good thing. The tread loop does scoot over to one side, but that hasn't stopped it from working and as I keep walking, it eventually evens out.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together! Works GREAT! I did have to have my husband put boards under the back to make it easier for me to use with less of a slant. I had read other reviews and was aware of that when I ordered!
customer_reviews.author: kambi

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: The treadmill is just as advertised and is really easy to assemble. Very little to assemble-and I am a 68 year old woman and had no trouble. I have found the treadmill to be very sturdy and I have no trouble walking on it. I have been an avid walker for many years so I am not a feeble woman and get a decent walking workout on it I do not use it for running but it seems as if it would be plenty sturdy for that also.I do like how it folds up to save space and and it is easy to fold.
customer_reviews.author: chastainwolf

customer_reviews.title: great product!
customer_reviews.text: a great price and well worth the money. though I have not used it as much as I was intending to! lol, it is an easy set-up and works well. I did purchase the lube for the belt too and feel that was a good idea after reading a few reviews. its a pretty basic unit and is very easy to store it when not in use. makes a bit more "noise" than I would have liked but maybe that would change if I used it more often! ha ha thank YOU
customer_reviews.author: ampm247

customer_reviews.title: It's not too bad..
customer_reviews.text: It's not too bad... for it's price. Can't use a dumbell with it. Have to walk with knees bent to hold onto to hand rails. PS: Get them real treadmill instead if you can afford it.
customer_reviews.author: leo

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: alignment and tension has prevented me from using this. I am constantly messing with it and it's never right. Wasted my money. very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: minimalist.mom

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this
customer_reviews.text: This is lies ! It’s not powered, it doesn’t plug into anything so you just have to use the weight of you body to push the belt so you can run. Walking is literally impossible in this thing
customer_reviews.author: Luma

customer_reviews.title: My first treadmill!
customer_reviews.text: I gotta say, I spent more time dragging it to my room to open it up than putting it together. Boy is it heavy. But it came in 5 pieces and within 10 minutes it was all set up. It was a little awkward walking on it at first but after a couple minutes I was running smoothly with no problems. The treadmill is a little narrow so for you long-legged people I would recommend the InMotion Manual Treadmill II.
customer_reviews.author: Arianna

customer_reviews.title: The good thing is that you don't have to waste electricity ...
customer_reviews.text: It skids too much. But you will need to get treadmill grease for it in order for it to not get stuck. The good thing is that you don't have to waste electricity by using a manual one. Just be careful jogging on it because it might be unstable for bigger people. Made for smaller people.
customer_reviews.author: Peace

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product
customer_reviews.text: Not what I expected and they wires to connect the monitor did not work.. you have to pull really hard to walk
customer_reviews.author: Mignon Smith

customer_reviews.title: Careful
customer_reviews.text: Be careful on this thing! I am a somewhat fit person but I will admit now I almost busted my behind a few times! If you want a workout this will surely give you one.
customer_reviews.author: Agmaloy

customer_reviews.title: Belt catches
customer_reviews.text: Arrived after scheduled delivery date. Now the belt keeps catching. It says I can add silicone spray. I feel like if it needs silicone spray to work then it should be included. By the time I wait for the spray to get here it will be a week before I can use my "prime" purchase.
customer_reviews.author: MrsSSG

customer_reviews.title: ... two years since I bought this and still works great and good
customer_reviews.text: it has been two years since I bought this and still works great and good quality
customer_reviews.author: lymarie

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work great and is very heavy and difficult to move around.
customer_reviews.author: laura peddell

customer_reviews.title: If your buying this to save money, don't.
customer_reviews.text: Not a smooth belt cycle. If your buying this to save money, don't. Save your money and buy an electric one. My wife won't use it and I barely do. Somethings you just need to see up close before you buy.
customer_reviews.author: Adoni

customer_reviews.title: not what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I thought buying a manual treadmill would be great since I would be able to to workout anywhere and not worry about wasting energy. like the other reviews setup was easy but using it was the hard part. You have to constantly hold on to the grip bars or risk sliding off and the belt doesn't run very smoothly so every other step is faster then the last. Im going to give it another go and if I still don't like it then im just going to sell it rather then return it since other reviews say that's another challenge.
customer_reviews.author: DisneyFreak

customer_reviews.title: Belt slips to left?
customer_reviews.text: I received my treadmill and assembled it and am using it. The reason I only gave it a 3 star rating is because I can't get the belt to stop slipping to the left. I've tightened the screws at end of belt and it still slips??? Should I use some silicone spray, will that solve the problem?
customer_reviews.author: Ellen J Glasgow

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something small that I could walk on while my newborn slept. It was easy to put together and looked nice, but that was it. Maybe it was just me, but it was hard to walk on. I can't imagine running on it. My knees and ankles were aching after 20 minutes. I am a pretty athletic person and normally I have no aches or pains. I returned this and purchased a used motorized treadmill instead.
customer_reviews.author: Noodlenoodle

customer_reviews.title: Good quality.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be good quality, but I find it a bit difficult to use. I can't seem to slow it enough for me to walk on for long. Then again I am an 81 yearold!!
customer_reviews.author: Norma  F Barta

customer_reviews.title: Returned and wouldn't buy again
customer_reviews.text: Belt was crooked on the one I got and I couldn't get it to even out. I had shipping problems and so I don't know if that contributed to this issue. The belt would also be really loose in some areas and then just stick in others. Walking on it was not possible. That seems to be more about the overall construction on this piece. Mine was returned.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: "Good bargain"
customer_reviews.text: First, I am an avid runner, and a cardo person. This treadmill does the job, because you have to work a little harder. Working a little harder helps burn more calories, therefore you lose more weight. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Ade O. Ogunmokun

customer_reviews.title: Missing part
customer_reviews.text: Got it out of the box, Got the two arms connected, not easily by myself as I am a senior citizen doing this myself. Go to hook the top handle bars on and find one of the Connection wires is missing from the Side arm. No way for me to get a replacement part as It has to go through the entire Leg/Arm to the bottome Unless they plan on sending an entire arm very very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Nana253

customer_reviews.title: Would change one thing
customer_reviews.text: Good quality product. The only thing I would have liked to be different is the handle bars being taller. I am taller than average and I have to bend to hold on to the handles. It works very well otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would not Recommend
customer_reviews.text: The effort that it takes to get this treadmill working fast enough to burn calories is ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Fitnes1408

customer_reviews.title: Super simple to put together
customer_reviews.text: Super simple to put together. I love that it is manual. That means I am putting in the work. I also love that I can fold it up when I am finished and tuck it away. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 😞
customer_reviews.text: Bolts are either to small for some places or holes were drilled to large, belt keeps coming loose. Not worth the money. You get what you pay for .
customer_reviews.author: NanaAmazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Look, If you want a 100-200 dollar machine to act like the 5000 dollar ones at the gym, you are kidding yourself. I paid near 120 for this guy and it shows. It will work for what I want it for, (watching tv NOT on the couch). I was not looking for a hardcore workout machine though, and I would not recommend running on it, jogging maybe, walking for sure, but that's about it.
customer_reviews.author: Talis

customer_reviews.title: Manual Treadmill
customer_reviews.text: It's OK for what it is...sold it and bought a motorized one...apparently us old(er) people need a motor...
customer_reviews.author: Ron McGuire

customer_reviews.title: Works great for winter months when it is too cold to get outside
customer_reviews.text: I choose this model because I did not need something fancy. I just wanted to keep up with walking during the winter months but did not want to walk outside because many of my neighbors don't clean their sidewalks. It is light weight and fits great any place. It was easy to put together and move around.
customer_reviews.author: Poakey

customer_reviews.title: i like that im really getting a workout on it
customer_reviews.text: i like that im really getting a workout on it. i am slightly over 200 and it creaks when i walk. dont feel that sturdy but i not going to be over 200 that long. my daughter is 140 and it works well with her. i
customer_reviews.author: LaVicki Smith

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best, manual treadmill I've seen. Folds to fit in a tiny space. Great price
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Cook

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome its definitely a hard workout and love that it folds up
customer_reviews.author: lauren

customer_reviews.title: Only for small fries
customer_reviews.text: This treadmill is exactly as advertised. However, this is not made for tall people. I am only 5' tall and this is perfect for me. My husband is over 6' tall and he said he was not comfortable on this. The treadmill is on an incline, so this is for walking only and you have to hold on to the rails. Works for me because my knees are a wreck from years of long distance cycling. However, I still want a low impact cardio workout to go along with my yoga. You are in total control of the speed.
customer_reviews.author: La Suzy

customer_reviews.title: Too much tinkering required.
customer_reviews.text: I ended up not being very happy with this unit. I spent too much time adjusting the belt so it wouldn't get ruined It's OK, but I need something I don't have to tinker with before during and after use.
customer_reviews.author: BarbraGenie

customer_reviews.title: Convience
customer_reviews.text: It worth to purchase. I doing indoor excise after work with it.
customer_reviews.author: Furel

customer_reviews.title: Great once set up.
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to assemble arrived in good pakaging, but really difficult to get the tension just right. A knob instead of a hex bolt would go a long way on this product.
customer_reviews.author: QAtester

customer_reviews.title: Its hard to keep your balance on it. Lol ...
customer_reviews.text: Its hard to keep your balance on it. Lol but that may just be me. It saved me tons on agym membership though. All i ever went to the gym for was the treadmills.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra

customer_reviews.title: The belt is not moving properly, shaking while walking
customer_reviews.text: The belt is not moving properly though after spraying silicon, looks very delicate
customer_reviews.author: Kannag

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: We are still having trouble adjusting to belt. It moves and has to be readjusted regularly.
customer_reviews.author: Marian P.

customer_reviews.title: Not for me.
customer_reviews.text: It's very hard to use. You have to hold yourself the whole time while walking what the point to that.
customer_reviews.author: Rosalyn Mercado

customer_reviews.title: love it, love it, love it
customer_reviews.text: this is so cute, and so easy to use. fits in my apt, so well, and you can walk backwards on it, you can do that on a reagular one. my mom wants one, my sister, etc. so glad i looked at the reviews before i bought it. you do have to work at little, but if you don't want to, stand more at the top. oh and i am a girl and not real good at putting things together, and i put it together in 15 min. thanks again, love it
customer_reviews.author: darlene webb

customer_reviews.title: Used it for a while but my shoulders started hurting ...
customer_reviews.text: Used it for a while but my shoulders started hurting from having to hold on, I passed it to a friend but I wouldn't buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Kathie

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great price and easy to use..Will have to get silicone spray to make smoother use though
customer_reviews.author: S. Howe

customer_reviews.title: treadmill
customer_reviews.text: It worked alright for a short time but the belt started running off track, too much to the right and then to the left. It is difficult to keep the belt centered and it's very noisy during operation. I've seen a similar model that operated differently but this one didn't meet my expectations. I'm not sure what I'll do with it; it sits unused because of the difficulties I've had with it.
customer_reviews.author: elizabeth pate

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a good workout like seriously good
customer_reviews.text: So worth the price and set up wasn't to difficult! Took maybe just over half an hour! Definitely a good workout like seriously good! And though not recommended but easy enough to use im currently on my phone writing this review while using it and already working up a sweat!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Too Short For Me
customer_reviews.text: This treadmill was easy to assemble and looked good however the handlebars did not rise high enough for my height. It forced me to bend my back forward to operate the machine. .t was uncomfortable with it so it was returned. The return process was painless.
customer_reviews.author: Ed KEim

product_meta.title: Stamina Inmotion Manual Treadmill (Pewter Grey, Black)
product_meta.description:
Includes owners manual. Dual weighted flywheels for smooth workouts. Two incline positions, 10 degrees and 8 degrees. Sturdy steel frame. Electronic monitor tracks workout time, speed, distance, calories burned, and scans with simple, one-button control. Lightweight with wheels for portability. Textured, non-slip walking or jogging surface. Foam padded front and side rails. Skid-resistant rubber floor protectors maximize stability. No electric outlet needed and no motor to maintain so it can be used anywhere. Running belt size: 41 in. long x 12.37 in. wide. Folds for easy storage. Warranty: One year for frame and 90 days for parts. Grey and black color. Assembly required. 47 in. L x 22 in. W x 45 in. H (49 lbs.). The InMotion t900 manual treadmill is the solution for getting a treadmill workout at home without the high cost. With dual weighted flywheels, you get a smooth workout at a walk or run you set the pace while the monitor tracks your distance, workout time, speed and calories burned. With no electric outlet needed and no motor to maintain, you can use it anywhere.

AMAZON.COM
The InMotion T900 Manual Treadmill from Stamina offers an economical running or walking workout without relying on an electric motor. With dual weighted flywheels, the T900 is built to deliver a smooth workout at a walk or run--while you set the pace. Meanwhile, the fitness monitor tracks your distance, workout time, speed, and calories burned. Two incline positions of 10 and 8 degrees offer additional challenge while padded side and front rails provide as-needed support. With no electric outlet necessary and no motor to maintain, you can use this treadmill anywhere. The steel frame folds to a 17 by 22-inch footprint and the built-in wheels allow you to roll it into a corner or closet with ease. 

- There may be a need to manually adjust the tension of the belt on this item and that should be done according to instructions in the assembly manual. They are factory pre-adjusted and yet there are times when the customer will want to make their own adjustments. If the instructions for this are followed according to the manual, the adjustment would be completed properly.

Key Features:

 * Dual weighted flywheels for smooth operation 
 * Two incline positions: 10 and 8 degrees 
 * Electronic monitor tracks workout time, speed, distance, calories burned, and scans with simple, one-button control 
 * Textured, non-slip walking/jogging surface 
 * Foam padded front and side rails 
 * Sturdy steel frame folds for storage 
 * Built-in wheels for portability 
 * Skid-resistant rubber floor protectors maximize stability 
 * Use anywhere-no electricity needed 

Specifications:

 * Running belt dimensions: 41 by 12 3/8 inches (L x W) 
 * Overall dimensions: 47 by 22 by 45 inches (L x W x H) 
 * Folded footprint: 17 x 22 inches 
 * Maximum user weight: 225 pounds 
 * Some assembly required 
 * One-year frame warranty 
 * 90-day parts warranty
feature_bullets: Manual treadmill with dual weighted flywheels and two incline positions (10 and 8 degrees),One-year frame warranty; 90-day parts warranty
Electronic monitor tracks time, speed, distance, calories burned, and scans, Sturdy, folding steel frame with wheels for portability
Textured, non-slip walking/jogging surface; foam padded front and side rails. The belt is factory adjusted but is also adjustable by consumer and this is explained with detail in the assembly manual.
No electric outlet needed and no motor to maintain so it can be used anywhere. Height - 45 inches
Folds for easy storage to 17 inch x 22 inch folded footprint
